title: 109_s2614
content: The Act titled "Alternative Energy Refueling System Act of 2006" focuses on alternative energy refueling systems. The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include definitions for alternative energy refueling systems, which are used to refuel vehicles with compressed natural gas, E-85 ethanol, or other specified fuels. The Administrator will establish a reimbursement program for eligible entities that own or operate service stations with alternative energy refueling systems. The program will reimburse eligible entities for a portion of the costs of purchasing and installing alternative energy refueling systems. Eligible entities must submit an application to the Administrator to receive reimbursement. The Administrator will provide reimbursement to eligible entities for alternative energy refueling systems within 30 days of verification that the system is installed and operational. Dual benefits are prohibited for eligible entities. The Administrator will reimburse eligible entities for alternative energy refueling systems within 30 days of installation and verification. Dual benefits are prohibited for entities receiving tax credits for alternative fuel vehicle refueling properties. The tax credit for alternative energy refueling systems is limited to 2 systems per facility owned or operated by the eligible entity. The reimbursement amount for each system is capped at the lesser of specified amounts. The tax credit for alternative energy refueling systems is limited to 2 systems per facility owned or operated by the eligible entity, with a reimbursement cap of 30 percent of the system cost or $30,000. The Administrator cannot use Trust Fund funds designated for other projects while implementing this provision. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to ensure compliance with provisions related to Trust Fund obligations for projects and activities. Additionally, the Superfund Amendments and Reauthorization Act of 1986 and the Alternative Energy Refueling System Act of 2006 are referenced for conformity.
